roleset.name: insure under a new or additional policy
roleset.note: REINSURE-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. Added due to parallel expansion of propbank, verbnet, and sense groupings. No verbnet class. No framenet mapping. Created by Katie. (from reinsure.01-v)

example.name: reinsure-v: new policy
example.text: [LandAmerica * 1] would pay his newly formed shop [ * 1]to reinsure the policy.

example.name: reinsure-v: provide additional insurance
example.text: The distressed agent told him that Lloyds of London had reinsured this packet of gems for 1.5 million dollars.

roleset.name: multiple insurance companies collectivly covering an item
roleset.note: REINSURANCE-N NOTES: Based on ontonouns. Slight comparison with insure.02. Framed by Katie. (from reinsurance.01-n)

example.name: reinsurance-n: args 0, 1
example.text: Life insurers are telling Congress that their reinsurance of federal employee programs is necessary and should not be eliminated.

example.name: reinsurance-n: arg5
example.text: This can push insurance companies away from purchasing reinsurance against large catastrophe events and toward purchasing reinsurance for smaller events.

example.name: reinsurance-n: arg2
example.text: Insurers purchase reinsurance for other insurers for a number of reasons

example.name: reinsurance-n: arg3
example.text: ...if an insurer would like to receive reinsurance for $10 million and negotiates a 20 percent ceding commission...
